public class ListBox<E> extends Component implements Drawable, Clickable
This class represents a list box.

leondietrich

  • Constructor Details

    • ListBox

      public ListBox(int x, int y, int width, int height, List<E> items, Callable<E> plusActionCallable, Consumer<E> editActionConsumer)
      Use this constructor in order to generate a new ListBox.
      Parameters:
      x - The x position of the list box.
      y - The y position of the list box.
      width - The width of the list box.
      height - The height of the list box.
      items - The item list to use. It might be smart to use an array list.
      plusActionCallable - A callable that will be triggered when the plus button was pressed. It needs to return a new entity of E that will be added to the items list. Keep in mind that this operation will run on the graphics thread so you can't introduce calls that require a long time to finish. The component won't be locked for new button presses while doing so.
      editActionConsumer - This consumer will be called with the item to edit if the user wishes to do so.

  • Method Details

    • checkedIfClicked

      public boolean checkedIfClicked(Vec2 clickPosition)
      Description copied from interface: Clickable
      This method gets called in order to check if the object on screen was clicked on. Do not perform any actions within this method as it may cause interference.
      Specified by:
      checkedIfClicked in interface Clickable
      Parameters:
      clickPosition - The position on the canvas where the user clicked at.
      Returns:
      true if you think that the user meant this object.

    • performAction

      public void performAction()
      Description copied from interface: Clickable
      After an controller agent selected the attached object as the target of the click action it will call this method. You may perform your (lightweight) operations now.
      Specified by:
      performAction in interface Clickable

      public void draw(Canvas c, Vec2 mouseLocation)
      Description copied from interface: Drawable
      Implement this method in order to draw your component.
      Specified by:
      draw in interface Drawable
      Parameters:
      c - The Canvas to draw on.
      mouseLocation - the location of the mouse relative to the canvas

    • getItems

      public List<E> getItems()
      Use this method in order to retrieve the items within this list.
      Returns:
      The items as a list of E
